â€œCultural Nuancesâ€ Dash Application (app.py)ïƒ

This page documents the Dash front-end used to explore cross-lingual word-association graphs derived from the SWOW enhancement pipeline. The app renders per-language subgraphs, a shared â€œCommonâ€ panel (cross-lingual overlaps), and interactive edge tables exposing synset pairs (â€œGemini pairsâ€) with domains and POS.

  • High-level Role

  • Minimal Lifecycle

  • Architecture & Module Map

  • Data & Control Flow

  • Key Responsibilities (per file)

    • app.py (this file)

    • view.py (UI & Callbacks)

    • graph.py (Graph Construction)

    • ui.py (Styling & Widgets)

    • utils.py (Text Utilities)

    • config.py (Configuration & Data)

    • Local development

    • Production (WSGI)

  • API Reference (Autodoc)

High-level Roleïƒ

app.py is the entrypoint:

  • Creates a Dash server (server = app.server for WSGI hosting).

  • Loads Cytoscape extra layouts.

  • Delegates UI construction and callbacks to view.

  • Mounts a clean, CDN-hosted CSS baseline (Normalize + Milligram).

Minimal Lifecycleïƒ

  1. Import UI and callbacks: from view import make_layout, register_callbacks

  2. Instantiate app: app = Dash(..., suppress_callback_exceptions=True)

  3. Load layouts: cyto.load_extra_layouts()

  4. Attach layout: app.layout = make_layout()

  5. Register interactivity: register_callbacks(app)

  6. Expose WSGI: server = app.server

  7. Run locally (port 8085)

from dash import Dash
import dash_cytoscape as cyto
from view import make_layout, register_callbacks

app = Dash(__name__, external_stylesheets=[...], suppress_callback_exceptions=True)
app.title = "Cultural Nuances"
server = app.server

cyto.load_extra_layouts()
app.layout = make_layout()
register_callbacks(app)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app.run_server(debug=False, port=8085)

Architecture & Module Mapïƒ

The app is deliberately thin; most logic is factored into small, focused modules:

  • view â€“ Page layout, control panel, callbacks (graph updates, edge-detail table).

  • graph â€“ Graph construction for single and multi-language views (graph_for_lang, build_graph).

  • ui â€“ Cytoscape stylesheet + convenience constructor (cygraph).

  • utils â€“ Text normalization, lemma extraction and EN translation heuristics.

  • config â€“ Data loading at import time (SWOW JSON, domain clusters, cue map) and UI constants.

Data & Control Flowïƒ

config (loads once) â†’ graph (builds nodes/edges) â†’ view (turns them into Cytoscape elements via ui.cygraph) â†’ Dash renders canvases and interactive tables.

config  â”€â”€â–º  graph  â”€â”€â–º  view  â”€â”€â–º  ui  â”€â”€â–º dash_cytoscape
  â–²                        â”‚
  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ utils â—„â”€â”€â”˜

Key Responsibilities (per file)ïƒ

app.py (this file)ïƒ

  • Entrypoint, WSGI server export.

  • Title, CSS, and Cytoscape layout registration.

  • No data logic; keeps concerns separated.

view.py (UI & Callbacks)ïƒ

  • Layout: header card, controls (cue dropdown, language checklist), three-panel graph grid, edge-detail table.

  • Callbacks: - update_graphs(cue, langs) â†’ renders per-language panels + Common panel and a domain legend. - display_gemini(tapEdgeData) â†’ deduplicates and formats the Gemini-pair table with POS, gloss, and domain.

graph.py (Graph Construction)ïƒ

  • graph_for_lang: builds native-label node set + edges for a language; clusters cue senses to collaborator-defined domains.

  • build_graph: composes Common overlaps and per-language Unique panels using: 1) BN-ID matches, 2) lemma-set overlaps, 3) attachment of leftovers.

ui.py (Styling & Widgets)ïƒ

  • Central Cytoscape stylesheet (node/edge classes: .cue, .common, .EN .ZH .NL).

  • cygraph helper that sets layout (cose-bilkent), zoom bounds, container styling.

utils.py (Text Utilities)ïƒ

  • English lemma extraction from translation tags (WN:EN:...).

  • Heuristics to pick best EN hints for ZH/NL cue and association labels.

  • NFKC normalization and simple stemming for EN/NL.

config.py (Configuration & Data)ïƒ

  • Absolute paths to input JSON/YAML (replace with env-vars for portability in production).

  • Loads: - DATA (enhanced SWOW JSON), - DOMAIN_CLUSTERS (cluster â†’ domain labels), - CUE_MAP + CUE_OPTIONS (for the dropdown).

  • UI constants: palette, language options.

Run & Deployïƒ

Local developmentïƒ

# install
poetry install
# run
poetry run python app.py
# open
xdg-open http://127.0.0.1:8085/  # or open your browser manually

Production (WSGI)ïƒ

Expose server to a WSGI server (e.g., Gunicorn or Waitress):

poetry run pip install gunicorn
poetry run gunicorn app:server --bind 0.0.0.0:8085 --workers 2

Documentation Build & Pages Publishïƒ

Build HTML:

poetry run sphinx-build -b html docs docs/_build/html

Quick publish via ghp-import (manual Pages deploy to gh-pages):

poetry run ghp-import -n -p -f docs/_build/html -b gh-pages
# then (if needed)
git push origin gh-pages

CI alternative (recommended): use a GitHub Actions workflow that builds Sphinx and deploys to GitHub Pages on push. See .github/workflows/docs.yml.

Reproducibility & Academic Useïƒ

The front-end isolates visual inference from data enhancement. All cross-lingual overlaps shown in the â€œCommonâ€ panel are derived algorithmically (BN-ID intersections, lemma overlaps, and conservative attachment of leftovers). This separation facilitates replication and ablation (swap ranking heuristics, change clustering, or toggle EN-hint display) without rewriting the UI.
